2 Fundamentals: Company Creation 2.1 Creating a Company

2 Fundamentals: Company Creation This chapter explains the basic steps for creating and maintaining a company in Tally Prime, including company details, statutory information (GST, TDS, TCS), and account management. 2.1 Creating a Company 2.1.1 Steps Open Tally Prime. From the Gateway of Tally, select Create Company. Enter the following details carefully: Field Description Directory The folder path where company data will be stored. Name Enter the legal name of the company (e.g., ABC Traders Pvt. Ltd.). Mailing Name This can be the same as the company name or a trade name. Address Enter the full postal address. Country and State Choose the correct location for GST and statutory compliance. Pincode Optional but recommended. Telephone No. / Mobile / Email / Website Contact information for invoices and reports. 2.1.2 Example Name: RK Enterprises Mailing Name: RK Enterprises Address: No. 12, Main Road, Chennai – 600001 Country: India State: Tamil Nadu Email: info@rkenterprises.in Figure: Company Creation screen in TallyPrime – entering name, address, mailing name, books-beginning date, currency symbol.

3 Company Features and Statutory Details After filling the basic company details, press F11: Features or F3: Statutory & Taxation to configure additional options. 3.1 (a) Enable Statutory & Taxation Set the following options to Yes as applicable: Option Purpose Enable Goods & Services Tax (GST) For GST-registered businesses. Enable Tax Deducted at Source (TDS) If applicable under the Income Tax Act. Enable Tax Collected at Source (TCS) For applicable transactions. When prompted, enter GST details: Field Example Entry GSTIN 33ABCDE1234F1Z5 Applicable from 01-04-2024 Type of Registration Regular / Composition Assessee Type Individual / Company / Partnership 3.2 Currency Symbol Setup Tally automatically assigns the ₹ (Rupee symbol) for Indian companies. To change or view the currency symbol: Go to Gateway of Tally → Accounts Info → Currencies → Alter. Edit the currency symbol or name as required. Example: $ for USD, £ for GBP. 3.3 Maintaining Accounts In the Company Creation screen: Maintain Accounts Only → For non-inventory businesses. Maintain Accounts with Inventory → For businesses dealing with goods or stock. Select the appropriate option based on business needs. 3.4 Selection, Closure, and Alteration of Company 3.4.1 (a) Selecting a Company From the Gateway of Tally, select Select Company. Choose the desired company name from the list. 3.4.2 (b) Altering Company Information From the Company Info screen, select Alter. Modify details such as address, email, or GSTIN. Press Ctrl + A to save. 3.4.3 (c) Closing a Company Press Alt + F1 (Shut Company) to close the current company. The system will return to the Company Info menu. 3.5 Backup and Security (Recommended) Backup: Go to Alt + F3 → Backup, choose the destination drive, and confirm. Restore: Use Alt + F3 → Restore when required. Security Control: Enable user-level access under F11 → Security Control. 3.6 Summary Operation Key Shortcut Purpose Create Company Alt + F3 Begin new company setup Select Company Alt + F1 Open existing company Alter Company Alt + F3 → Alter Modify details Shut Company Alt + F1 Close company Backup Alt + F3 → Backup Save data copy  Tip: Always verify company information after creation and before entering vouchers to ensure accuracy in GST and financial reporting.
